commit_message:
Remove handling of instance_uuid removals

This removes the backwards compatible layer that was added in
I58bc848ab3a60d3e9ab16d00ce96a603df1c244a to support old
(Liberty & earlier) versions of nova that would issue requests
to remove instance UUIDs from nodes.

Ironic handles the removal of instance UUIDs when tearing down
a node and newer (Mitaka) versions of nova don't issue those
requests any more.

Change-Id: Ia320b16d06f2b53e02c41270826cae750a3454f2

This conditional # should be removed in the next cycle (Mitaka). remove_inst_uuid_patch = [{'op': 'remove', 'path': '/instance_uuid'}] if (rpc_node.provision_state in (ir_states.CLEANING, ir_states.CLEANWAIT) and patch == remove_inst_uuid_patch): # The instance_uuid is already removed as part of the node's # tear down, skip this update. return Node.convert_with_links(rpc_node) elif rpc_node.maintenance and patch == remove_inst_uuid_patch: LOG.debug('Removing instance uuid %(instance)s from node %(node)s', {'instance': rpc_node.instance_uuid, 'node': rpc_node.uuid}) elif (rpc_node.target_provision_state and rpc_node.provision_state not in ir_states.UPDATE_ALLOWED_STATES):

commit_message:
Fix SST check for MySQL OCF RA

Make sure start/monitor actions will exit OK,
if SST's in progress

Closes-bug: #1572239

Change-Id: I1a82f383ce0deba1e4b3d0db0634329a74f03ce6
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/32/308232/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: check_if_sst() { local LH="${LL} check_if_sst():" local loglevel=${1:-'info'} if [ -f "${OCF_RESKEY_datadir}"/sst_in_progress ]; then ocf_log $loglevel "${LH} SST is in progress" return $OCF_SUCCESS fi return $OCF_ERR_GENERIC } check_if_sst [ $? -eq $OCF_SUCCESS ] && return $OCF_SUCCESS # Spin waiting for the server to come up or exit, if SST's in progress check_if_sst [ $? -eq $OCF_SUCCESS ] && break
deleted_lines: if [ -f "${OCF_RESKEY_datadir}"/sst_in_progress ]; then ocf_log $loglevel "${LH} SST is in progress" return $OCF_SUCCESS fi # Spin waiting for the server to come up.

commit_message:
[OraclePDBConnector] Initial commit of Oracle PDB Connector.

This application enables creation of Oracle Pluggable Databases
on top of Oracle Container Database.

All instructions for application deployment are provided in readme.rst.

Change-Id: Id7a9823dcc43f65fd90805e21758ec9298b39283
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-apps refs/changes/21/266521/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Copyright 2015 Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # # Export env variables . ./ora_env.sh sql_file="$ORACLE_USER_HOME/pdb_create_$$.sql" # Create pluggable database # Open the pluggable database for read-write cat > $sql_file << EOF CONNECT / as sysdba; SET LINESIZE 100; SET PAGESIZE 50; CREATE PLUGGABLE DATABASE $1 ADMIN USER $ADMIN_USER IDENTIFIED BY $ADMIN_PWD roles=(CONNECT,DBA) FILE_NAME_CONVERT = ('$PDBSEED', '$ORADATA/$1'); ALTER PLUGGABLE DATABASE $1 OPEN; EXIT; EOF chown oracle:oracle $sql_file # Execute the sql statements su - oracle -c ". ~/ora_env.sh && sqlplus /nolog @$sql_file $1" # remove the sql_file rm -f $sql_file

commit_message:
Add an option to retrieve X-Forwarded-For as remote address

Keystone could be behind a proxy and requests will log the address
of the proxy server instead of the actual original request.

Closes-Bug: 1554274
Closes-Bug: 1550127

Change-Id: I0fb6afd2fe76b5295dbe337af446a0c87c595414
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/75/293575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Get the remote address, even if it is proxied, store it in context remote_address = req.remote_addr if CONF.use_forwarded_for: remote_address = req.headers.get('X-Forwarded-For', remote_address) context['remote_address'] = remote_address {'exception': e, 'remote_addr': context['remote_address']})

commit_message:
DVR: rebind port if ofport changes

When binding is called in DVR, check to see if the port was
previously wired under a different ofport. If it was, first
unbind the old port and then bind the new one.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I372158c4a6986295e396d849a2c9c5372b271e08
Closes-Bug: #1562467
(cherry picked from commit 4731dbbef1f615b9ce6d18315e8ca9810e8a772d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/44/299044/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if (port.vif_id in self.local_ports and self.local_ports[port.vif_id].ofport != port.ofport): LOG.info(_LI("DVR: Port %(vif)s changed port number to " "%(ofport)s, rebinding."), {'vif': port.vif_id, 'ofport': port.ofport}) self.unbind_port_from_dvr(port, local_vlan_map)

subject: Split the FIP Namespace delete in L3 agent for DVR
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-27 21:01:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d7533c4d0a710b78d473d1676612717f2bcc4f6b', 'message': 'Split the FIP Namespace delete in L3 agent for DVR

Right now we are seeing a race condition in the l3 agent
for DVR routers when a floatingip is deleted and created.

The agent tries to delete the floatingip namespace and
while it tries to delete there is another call to add a
namespace. There is a timing window in between these two
calls where sometimes the call to create a namespace succeeds
but, when tried to execute any commands in the namespace
it fails, since the namespace was deleted concurrently.

Since the fip namespace is associated with an external net
and each node has only one fip namespace for an external net,
we would like to only delete the fip namespace when the
external net is deleted.

The first step is to split the delete functionality into two.
The call to fip_ns.cleanup will only remove the dependency that
the fipnamespace has with the router namespace such as fpr and
rfp veth pairs.

The call to fip_ns.delete will actually delete the
the fip namespace and the fg device.

Partial-Bug: #1501873
(cherry picked from commit c874f6dadaa983ed4f338808907c8829a7f86031)

commit_message:
Split the FIP Namespace delete in L3 agent for DVR

Right now we are seeing a race condition in the l3 agent
for DVR routers when a floatingip is deleted and created.

The agent tries to delete the floatingip namespace and
while it tries to delete there is another call to add a
namespace. There is a timing window in between these two
calls where sometimes the call to create a namespace succeeds
but, when tried to execute any commands in the namespace
it fails, since the namespace was deleted concurrently.

Since the fip namespace is associated with an external net
and each node has only one fip namespace for an external net,
we would like to only delete the fip namespace when the
external net is deleted.

The first step is to split the delete functionality into two.
The call to fip_ns.cleanup will only remove the dependency that
the fipnamespace has with the router namespace such as fpr and
rfp veth pairs.

The call to fip_ns.delete will actually delete the
the fip namespace and the fg device.

Partial-Bug: #1501873
(cherry picked from commit c874f6dadaa983ed4f338808907c8829a7f86031)
Change-Id: Ic94625d5a968f554af70c274b2b2c20ab64e2487
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/35/273235/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ri.floating_ip_removed_dist(fip_cidr) self.assertTrue(fip_ns.destroyed) mIPWrapper().del_veth.assert_called_once_with( fip_ns.get_int_device_name(router['id'])) mIPDevice().route.delete_gateway.assert_called_once_with( str(fip_to_rtr.ip), table=16) fip_ns.unsubscribe.assert_called_once_with(ri.router_id)
deleted_lines: with mock.patch.object(self.plugin_api, 'delete_agent_gateway_port') as del_fip_gw: ri.floating_ip_removed_dist(fip_cidr) self.assertTrue(del_fip_gw.called) self.assertTrue(fip_ns.destroyed) mIPWrapper().del_veth.assert_called_once_with( fip_ns.get_int_device_name(router['id'])) mIPDevice().route.delete_gateway.assert_called_once_with( str(fip_to_rtr.ip), table=16) fip_ns.unsubscribe.assert_called_once_with(ri.router_id) fip_ns.local_subnets.allocate.assert_called_once_with( ri.router_id)

commit_message:
Run nova service-list only for online controllers

nova service-list only needs to report the status
of online controllers. Down and deleted nodes should
not cause the test to fail.

Change-Id: I56765f6cf889b6afb9780b32857a164e2b62c340
Related-Bug: #1570847

commit_message:
Fix remaining json reference warnings

This fixes the last json reference warning which exist. It also trims
out the baremetal API calls that we don't support any more (we only
have the readonly proxy). That was erroneously added to the compute
API docs in refactors of api-site last cycle.

commit_message:
Check if snapshot name already in use.

 - Fix for devops so it doesn't throw exception when trying to create
    snapshot with already used name.
 - Modified unit test for shell.

Change-Id: I9fc94c4499b9f766e71e036eac2c17927da8bafb
Closes-bug:#1552202

subject: Use messaging notifications transport instead of default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 09:20:26.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/messaging.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/afbbe071b1e9b291dcba34f1b50c8fdd5ea509f8', 'message': "Use messaging notifications transport instead of default

The usage of oslo_messaging.get_transport is not meant for
notifications; And oslo_messaging.get_notification_transport is
favored for those means. So this change introduces the usage of that
function.

If the settings for the notifications are not set with the
configuration that's under the oslo_messaging_notifications group,
this will fall back to the old settings which are under the DEFAULT
group; just like this used to work.

Change-Id: I52d7a72dadd10ade1f5335f14c58391271e209c2
"}]
commit_message:
Use messaging notifications transport instead of default

The usage of oslo_messaging.get_transport is not meant for
notifications; And oslo_messaging.get_notification_transport is
favored for those means. So this change introduces the usage of that
function.

If the settings for the notifications are not set with the
configuration that's under the oslo_messaging_notifications group,
this will fall back to the old settings which are under the DEFAULT
group; just like this used to work.

Change-Id: I52d7a72dadd10ade1f5335f14c58391271e209c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/96/305696/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NOTIFICATIONS_TRANSPORT = Nonedef get_specific_transport(url, optional, exmods, is_for_notifications=False): try: if is_for_notifications: return oslo_messaging.get_notification_transport( cfg.CONF, url, allowed_remote_exmods=exmods, aliases=_ALIASES) else: return oslo_messaging.get_transport( cfg.CONF, url, allowed_remote_exmods=exmods, aliases=_ALIASES) except oslo_messaging.InvalidTransportURL as e: if not optional or e.url: # NOTE(sileht): oslo_messaging is configured but unloadable # so reraise the exception raise else: return None def setup_transports(url, optional): global TRANSPORT, NOTIFICATIONS_TRANSPORT oslo_messaging.set_transport_defaults('heat') exmods = ['heat.common.exception'] TRANSPORT = get_specific_transport(url, optional, exmods) NOTIFICATIONS_TRANSPORT = get_specific_transport(url, optional, exmods, is_for_notifications=True) global NOTIFIER if not TRANSPORT or not NOTIFICATIONS_TRANSPORT: setup_transports(url, optional) if not NOTIFIER and NOTIFICATIONS_TRANSPORT: NOTIFIER = oslo_messaging.Notifier(NOTIFICATIONS_TRANSPORT, serializer=serializer) global TRANSPORT, NOTIFICATIONS_TRANSPORT, NOTIFIER NOTIFICATIONS_TRANSPORT.cleanup() TRANSPORT = NOTIFICATIONS_TRANSPORT = NOTIFIER = None
deleted_lines: global TRANSPORT, NOTIFIER if not TRANSPORT: oslo_messaging.set_transport_defaults('heat') exmods = ['heat.common.exception'] try: TRANSPORT = oslo_messaging.get_transport( cfg.CONF, url, allowed_remote_exmods=exmods, aliases=_ALIASES) except oslo_messaging.InvalidTransportURL as e: TRANSPORT = None if not optional or e.url: # NOTE(sileht): oslo_messaging is configured but unloadable # so reraise the exception raise if not NOTIFIER and TRANSPORT: NOTIFIER = oslo_messaging.Notifier(TRANSPORT, serializer=serializer) global TRANSPORT, NOTIFIER TRANSPORT = NOTIFIER = None

commit_message:
use thread safe fnmatch

fnmatch is not thread safe in python <2.7.10, let's use the safe
one in oslo.utils

Change-Id: I52b15c6be5a6a417b0dc842323d4933d1bf01422
ref: https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/fe12c34c39eb

commit_message:
Make sync_db_api enabled by default

According to the release notes[0], in Mitaka a second database
specifically for the api is required. Flip sync_db_api to being
true by default.

[0] "Nova now requires that two databases are available and configured.
The existing nova database needs no changes, but a new nova_api database
needs to be setup."
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/mitaka.html

Change-Id: Ia5fa8ba70b7ce151e7e904f5e8f94658a98dd295
Depends-On: I2af56c4d8e8d7de44e641e4a8fc8989da86ac284
(cherry picked from commit 4f01c3537c68c4c25b94023e7c16bd2be2cb6526)

commit_message:
Start libvirt after installing it

The libvirt service needs startup scripts installed by the package
before it can start, so make sure the package is installed first.

Depends-On: I2af56c4d8e8d7de44e641e4a8fc8989da86ac284
Change-Id: I2d03f50a8d633b2d7a273736857da8fe46593a37

commit_message:
Add ml2 package requirement to neutron::plugins::ml2::mech_driver

In certain scenarios the neutron::plugins::ml2::mech_driver was being
executed before the $::neutron::params::ml2_server_package which
caused problems while trying to write plugin files.

Depends-On: I2af56c4d8e8d7de44e641e4a8fc8989da86ac284
Change-Id: I31fa00030201b86baca14f9cb3bccab91c593e85
(cherry picked from commit 2b4cba7c87bcb46d3b5c9919948f03bbc33a6a0b)

commit_message:
Switch mistral to use puppet-oslo module

rabbit messaging, db, logging parameters were
configured by puppet-oslo module:

* switch messaging related parameters to $::os_service_default
  as they are used in oslo::messaging_rabbit define
* update unit test

Change-Id: Id9c820f446b040625611223cb0fd778a3f7a2203

oslo.service doesn't do a monkey_patch, hence it is danger to mix
eventlet thread and traditional thread, let's remove eventlet timer

Change-Id: Ie4e73a8d5e9c19cbaa9a3b18a92a9914f6d4edf1
"}]
commit_message:
replace eventlet timer with thread manner

oslo.service doesn't do a monkey_patch, hence it is danger to mix
eventlet thread and traditional thread, let's remove eventlet timer
as we do for Ceilometer.

Change-Id: Ie4e73a8d5e9c19cbaa9a3b18a92a9914f6d4edf1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/69/308769/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import threading from concurrent import futuresfrom futurist import periodics ef = lambda: futures.ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=10) self.periodic = periodics.PeriodicWorker.create( [], executor_factory=ef) if self.evaluators: @periodics.periodic(spacing=self.conf.evaluation_interval, run_immediately=not delay_start) def evaluate_alarms(): self._evaluate_assigned_alarms() self.periodic.add(evaluate_alarms) @periodics.periodic(spacing=heartbeat_interval, run_immediately=True) def heartbeat(): self.partition_coordinator.heartbeat() self.periodic.add(heartbeat) t = threading.Thread(target=self.periodic.start) t.daemon = True t.start() # NOTE(sileht): We have to drop eventlet to drop this last eventlet # thread def stop(self): self.periodic.stop() self.periodic.wait() self.partition_coordinator.stop() super(AlarmEvaluationService, self).stop()
deleted_lines: if self.evaluators: interval = self.conf.evaluation_interval self.tg.add_timer( interval, self._evaluate_assigned_alarms, initial_delay=interval if delay_start else None) self.tg.add_timer(heartbeat_interval, self.partition_coordinator.heartbeat)

commit_message:
Split apt_components for bare metal provisioning

The openstack-ppa.list file gets generated with an extra 'trusty'
resulting in a failed convergence on bare metal nodes.

Change-Id: I22235c3eed6a9abd0371d86ea80b71e4702e9ea4

commit_message:
run nova-api with mod_proxy_uwsgi httpd module

Several benefits of running Nova API with mod_proxy_uwsgi httpd module:

* consistent with Keystone API
* improve memory consumption
* allow to configure complex configurations, such SSL, proxy options,
  security, etc.
* allow to easily run containers of nova-api services sharing the same
  nova.conf for common configuration but having specific configuration
  for binding options in the container.

This patch also includes the upgrade process to Nova API running in
mod_wsgi with Apache.

Change-Id: Ia7ed3a5625fb9a3443dc83e51f176059b30f92fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/31/307431/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Always use lan if possible

For the centos case on mac, when both air port and usb ethernet are
available, need to use ethernet to avoid network failures.
Rearranged the other to try to use LAN first, then WAN.

Change-Id: I1a0319a54f4425a1b741a9da04517c93fb60f701

commit_message:
Enable abandon option to nested resource

Resources use abandon_in_progress option for abandoning in
prepare_abandon method. When abandon_in_progress, resource's
deletion policy is "Retain" and resource will not delete. Nested
resource prepare_abandon missed enabling that option, so all nested
stacks delete.

Change-Id: I819566e4e1ca81193c745dcdd89217f31db41b07
Closes-bug: #1509912

Change tox file

Add upper-constraints and min tox version.

This will prevent taking in packages that
are greater then what is defined in the
upper-constraints

commit_message:
Devstack: Change to use 'ovs-vsctl get port tag'

OVS provides a method to get port tag directly, so we don't
need to show all ports' details and grep the desired tag number.

Change-Id: I5f3fc11a802fcb5e58dd1bf74e7fc9ff29677bb2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/43/307543/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tag_id=$(sudo ovs-vsctl get port ${tapdev} tag)
deleted_lines: tag_id=$(sudo ovs-vsctl show |grep ${tapdev} -A1 -m1 | grep tag | cut -d':' -f2 | cut -b2-)

commit_message:
Replace the packstack-dev channel by rdo

We are retiring the packstack-dev channel and are moving packstack
related things to #rdo.
We also want to benefit from the eavesdrop logging service.

Change-Id: I9067dce0130546c3cbce1723d0ad79145d4706f7

commit_message:
Renamed IronicNodeTransition to IronicNodeProvisionTransition

There are several different kinds of provisioning in Ironic- provision,
inspection, power, and maintenance. They're all handled separately,
and we need to be able to address them as such.

Change-Id: Ia5d1d01794ff914db36091c222433ffe34c11c93

commit_message:
Added capitalize filter

This filter capitalizes all words in the passed string. It is
intended as a temporary shim for string formatting, until we can
get i18n incorporated.

Change-Id: I0a7b0d61d27d24cb2ccf2a2ff2757097cab10ba7

commit_message:
ssl_cert and ssl_key file can be one big .pem file

* added condition for the case that ssl_cert_file and ssl_key_file are shipped
  toghether in one .pem file (the .pem file should only be touched once)

Change-Id: I7d4d593249bda2701b29a4a8585f8267cb815190
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-dashboard refs/changes/75/299875/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: unless ssl_cert_file == ssl_key_file cert_mode = 00644 cert_owner = 'root' cert_group = 'root' file ssl_cert_file do content ssl_cert mode cert_mode owner cert_owner group cert_group notifies :run, 'execute[restore-selinux-context]', :immediately end file ssl_key_file do
deleted_lines: cert_mode = 00644 cert_owner = 'root' cert_group = 'root' file ssl_cert_file.to_s do content ssl_cert mode cert_mode owner cert_owner group cert_group notifies :run, 'execute[restore-selinux-context]', :immediately file ssl_key_file.to_s do

subject: Remove user/role prefetch to support multi-domain.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 11:10:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/c9a685ccab4849b3a7c2c9a9da967a284f0246f7', 'message': 'WIP: Remove user/role prefetch to support multi-domain.

In keystone when the multi-domain configuration is enable, listing all
the user is no longer supported.  You have to specify the domain.  The
rational is that some domain will have LDAP backend (possibly AD) with
tons of users.  Listing them all would not be reliable.

The prefetch feature in puppet needs to know all users and create an
associated object.  This is not a good idea when the number of user is
too high.  Thus the removal of this is necessary.  The rational for
using prefetch is that checking all items in one go "cost" less than
fetching individual information.  As the number of user defined in the
catalog is likely to be less than the number of user in the keystone db,
this seems dubious that this would be case here, hence the removal.

WIP: As a consequence the keystone_user_role needs prefetch removal as
well.

Closes-Bug: 1554555
Closes-Bug: 1485508

Change-Id: I8e117a9ddbd2ed5b3df739a0b27a66ad07a33e29
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-30 11:12:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/999076cab698ed18f323b4f309dac168185dbab0', 'message': 'WIP: Remove user/role prefetch to support multi-domain.

In keystone when the multi-domain configuration is enable, listing all
the user is no longer supported.  You have to specify the domain.  The
rational is that some domain will have LDAP backend (possibly AD) with
tons of users.  Listing them all would not be reliable.

The prefetch feature in puppet needs to know all users and create an
associated object.  This is not a good idea when the number of user is
too high.  Thus the removal of this is necessary.  The rational for
using prefetch is that checking all items in one go "cost" less than
fetching individual information.  As the number of user defined in the
catalog is likely to be less than the number of user in the keystone db,
this seems dubious that this would be case here, hence the removal.

WIP: As a consequence the keystone_user_role needs prefetch removal as
well.

Closes-Bug: 1554555
Closes-Bug: 1485508

Change-Id: I8e117a9ddbd2ed5b3df739a0b27a66ad07a33e29

using prefetch is that checking all items in one go "cost" less than
fetching individual information.  As the number of user defined in the
catalog is likely to be less than the number of user in the keystone db,
this seems dubious that this would be case here, hence the removal.

commit_message:
Remove user/role prefetch to support multi-domain.

In keystone when the multi-domain configuration is enable, listing all
the user is no longer supported.  You have to specify the domain.  The
rational is that some domain will have LDAP backend (possibly AD) with
tons of users.  Listing them all would not be reliable.

The prefetch feature in puppet needs to know all users and create an
associated object.  This is not a good idea when the number of user is
too high.  Thus the removal of this is necessary.  The rational for
using prefetch is that checking all items in one go "cost" less than
fetching individual information.  As the number of user defined in the
catalog is likely to be less than the number of user in the keystone db,
this seems dubious that this would be case here, hence the removal.

As a consequence the keystone_user_role needs prefetch removal as well.
It actually greatly simplify the code.  A cache is made for user and
project id to minimize the number of requests to the minimum.

Closes-Bug: 1554555
Closes-Bug: 1485508

Depends-On: I5b334e3ffd26df4ba8584d77a5e41b56e73536c8
Change-Id: I8e117a9ddbd2ed5b3df739a0b27a66ad07a33e29

commit_message:
Send node report message only after convertion.

After change proxy reporter behavior: now Astute send all messages
and validation only warn about possible problems.

But from this moment Astute do not convert node name virtual_sync_node
to real null for some messages e.g. error about deployment.
This change fix it.

Change-Id: I016c3a2847aae15e2166922a7a9e5c1cd8110a74
Related-Bug: #1549323
(cherry picked from commit de96a4b4bddcb5ba2e15dc930340f3efdec06ae7)

commit_message:
Improve error message of when Conflict error occur in ng-swift

When we create a container, folder or object, error will occur if the
specified name is already exist. And when we delete, if specified
container or folder have a content, error will occur.
At the moment, error message is always same in all cases.
This patch will improve the message of when Conflict exception occur.

Change-Id: I825ef09badd1b10bb6fdab8f223bd6dfed28f3a4
Closes-bug: #1566820

commit_message:
Support stop deployment for already deployed cluster with LCM

Task based deployment (>=9.0) implements save way to stop
deployment action, so we can enable stop deployment for such
cluster without restrictions. But it is still need to be
disabled for old env < 9.0 which was already deployed once[1]

Add tests

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1529691

Change-Id: I4284f70f00c5c0b2db026df748c1f73fcd941bf1
Closes-Bug: #1571713

Use the cached ironic-python-agent images

commit_message:
<VMWare> Allocate free bus for new SCSI controller

There are at most 16 virtual disks that can be attached onto a SCSI
controller, while if the limitation is reached, error occurs
with message "VMwareDriverException: Invalid configuration for
device '0'".

The reason is that when the controller's quota is used up, a new
controller will be created automatically, but the newly-created
one will try to use bus number 0, which is already used my existing
controller.

This change will allocate a new free bus number for the newly-created
controller.

Co-Authored-By: Qiaowei Ren <qiaowei.ren@intel.com>

Closes bug: #1522232

Change-Id: I2ced1358e682cda979d1d5bddb6359253699280b
(cherry picked from commit b36da5dd037219ceb71c4c6ea6925d2eba6cd59b)

commit_message:
The 'record' option of the WebSocketProxy should be string

If proxy service (VNC, spice, serial) is started with the 'record'
option, an exception is thrown. This is because WebSocketProxy
expects a file path for the record argument instead of boolean
value. This patch fixes this by changing 'record' to be string
option. An empty string means no recording.

Closes-Bug: #1559026

Change-Id: Id6cf7c65191bdaa579f7cdadea43230897436de6
(cherry picked from commit c5311439d6526006dd1354e09f2bfb86505d550d)

commit_message:
Update libvirt-python upper-requirement

Some distros have updated their stable version of libvirt-python causing
conflicts. This patch updates the cap to 1.3.2.

More specifically, Gentoo has update the stable version of it's libvirt
to 1.3.1.  This currently causes warnings stating that libvirt and
python-libvirt are being held back by nova/neutron as they cap
libvirt-python to 1.3.0.  Eventually, we will remove the old stable
versions from our tree and we will have an error, not just a warning.

Change-Id: Ifc010197fad26c0dff18e494c907b03ccadbde77

Until we move the current-tripleo pin to include this revert, I'm
not sure our upgrades job will work:

issues are now being seen in CI on update.

commit_message:
Changed the swift storage URL retrieval command

this change forces ironic to interact with the OpenStack InternalURL
instead of trying to use the public one. This is needed to ensure Ironic
isn't instructing it's nodes to retrieve user images from a public address
that they may not have access to.

Change-Id: Ibfeba53c2be802c51a3edc386e50fcbab8d0b01b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 26a603fa8739dd83ff543d293fffea3ff3852fad)

commit_message:
Enable HAProxy forwardfor option for Horizon.

Horizon's backends (httpd) see IP address of the haproxy in the logs instead
of the client address.
Adding forwardfor option allows to add the client address to the
X-Forwarded-For HTTP header and can be replace in the logs by configured the
backend servers with this header.

Change-Id: I54f0f5549d64768dacca71539c71a28cc99d9d95

commit_message:
Add destination parameter to firewall rule

Specifying a destination cidr is already supported by
puppetlabs-firewall, we just need to pass through the parameter in
rule.pp in puppet-tripleo.

This will allow creating iptables rules that forward network traffic for
a given cidr via puppet-tripleo.

Change-Id: I23582a55cd97248be52f45e14de7e813ff499ff7

commit_message:
Manage policy configuration file

This change includes the aodh_config configuration of the policy file in
the aodh::policy class.

'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2016-04-05 05:34:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/93ea72de05428df749f956a2ebf3e097e0b20344', 'message': 'Adding neutron-dynamic-routing as neutron's stadium project.

Scope:
This patch propose adding BGP dynamic routing effort for Neutron
as a separate neutron-official project. As a part of this effort,
we would like to address the followings:
 * Getting a new repository named 'neutron-dynamic-routing' created.
 * Move the existing BGP dynamic routing code from the Neutron &
   python-neutronclient master branch to the newer repository.
 * Set up Jenkins CI jobs (pep8, py27, py34, API, functional,
   full-stack).
 * Add devstack support.
 * Proper documentation.
 * Starting a seprate IRC meeting.

Why a new project:
Separte repository will provide more flexibility and access
developing dynamic routing functionality in Neutron. In addition
most of us feel having a separate repository will be good.
Details about our discussion can be found @
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_l3/2016/neutron_l3.2016-01-14-15.06.log.html

commit_message:
Adding a new project called "neutron-dynamic-routing"

Scope:
------
This patch propose adding BGP dynamic routing effort for Neutron
as a separate neutron-official project. As a part of this effort,
we would like to address the followings:
 * Getting a new repository named 'neutron-dynamic-routing' created.
 * Move the existing BGP dynamic routing code from the Neutron &
   python-neutronclient master branch to the newer repository.
 * Run the existing tests (py27, py34, API and Functional) successfully
   via the relevant CI jobs.
 * Add devstack support.
 * Proper documentation.
 * Check the feasibility of starting a separate IRC meeting. (Currently,
   we are a part of L3 team meeting. Will start a separate IRC meeting,
   if the L3 team feels so.)

Why a new project:
------------------
Separate repository will provide more flexibility and access
developing dynamic routing functionality in Neutron. In addition
most of us feel having a separate repository will be good.
Details about our discussion can be found @
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_l3/2016/neutron_l3.2016-01-14-15.06.log.html

Project Details:
----------------
pypi project: https://pypi.python.org/pypi?%3Aaction=pkg_edit&name=neutron-dynamic-routing
launchpad project: https://launchpad.net/neutron

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Tidwell <ryan.tidwell@hpe.com>
Implements: blueprint bgp-spinout
Partial-Bug: #1560003
Needed-By: If0380e4d0e30a46f77467945ecba8a698d1930a1

commit_message:
Add purge_config option for the cinder config

Adding a purge_config option for the cinder config resource. Adding this
option for ease of management and readability. If users wish they can
use this to ensure that only the options they are setting make it into
the configs.

Change-Id: I1e01ca47e3a0edb401cb6ef3bbafc905032adf0c

commit_message:
Pass glance image parameters as a hash

This change updates the deployment serializer for the test vm data to
pass the glance properties as a hash that can be used by the
glance_image provider rather than using the glance_properties string
that is currently in place. The glance_properties string should be
considered deprecated and anything that uses it should switch to the
properties hash.

DocImpact: glance_properties string provided as part of the
test_vm_image hiera data is deprecated in favor of the properties hash
provided by this change

Change-Id: I79a9b20d89ae00a7ceaa24c4ce655cbd16972c30
Partial-Bug: #1566434
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/35/301835/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: properties_data = {} properties_data = { 'vmware_disktype': 'sparse', 'vmware_adaptertype': 'lsiLogic', 'hypervisor_type': 'vmware' } for key, value in six.iteritems(properties_data): glance_properties.append('--property {key}={value}'.format( key=key, value=value)) # TODO(aschultz): remove glance_properties in O, properties replaces it image_data['properties'] = properties_data properties_data = { 'vmware_disktype': 'sparse', 'vmware_adaptertype': 'lsiLogic', 'hypervisor_type': 'vmware' } glance_properties = [] for key, value in six.iteritems(properties_data): glance_properties.append('--property {key}={value}'.format( key=key, value=value)) # TODO(aschultz): remove glance_properties in O, properties # replaces it image_vmdk_data['glance_properties'] = ' '.join(glance_properties) image_vmdk_data['properties'] = properties_data
deleted_lines: glance_properties.append('--property vmware_disktype=sparse') glance_properties.append('--property vmware_adaptertype=lsiLogic') glance_properties.append('--property hypervisor_type=vmware') image_vmdk_data['glance_properties'] = ' '.join([ '--property vmware_disktype=sparse', '--property vmware_adaptertype=lsiLogic', '--property hypervisor_type=vmware'])

commit_message:
Fix reverse_upsize_quota_delta attempt to look up deleted flavors

When we did the "great flavor migration of 2015" we missed a quota method
which still looks up flavors by id from the migration. Now that flavors
are moved to the api database and actually removed when deleted, this no
longer works. The problem manifests itself as a failure when trying to
revert a migration or resize operation when the original flavor has been
deleted.

Change-Id: I5f95021410a309ac07fe9f474cbcd0214d1af208
Closes-Bug: #1570748
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/38/307438/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def reverse_upsize_quota_delta(context, instance): return resize_quota_delta(context, instance.new_flavor, instance.old_flavor, -1, -1)
deleted_lines: def reverse_upsize_quota_delta(context, migration_ref): old_flavor = objects.Flavor.get_by_id( context, migration_ref['old_instance_type_id']) new_flavor = objects.Flavor.get_by_id( context, migration_ref['new_instance_type_id']) return resize_quota_delta(context, new_flavor, old_flavor, -1, -1)

commit_message:
Put correct release version into metadata.yaml for plugin_reboot

As we are using FPB from master branch we can not rely on
generated metadata.yaml file because it can contains wrong release.
Allow FuelPluginBuilder to modify metadata.yaml by data received from
nailgun

Change-Id: Ic020df8b7e677830f5a71be18b6a241417946b08
Closes-bug:1569327

commit_message:
Fix update_network_cidr method

subnet() method of netaddr.IPNetwork expects size of subnets to be returned
so we should pass to it subnet of the smaller size, not 1

Change-Id: Id6b7e8e43419d224cc1c3202ffd253664245d5d4
Closes-Bug: #1571543
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/54/308154/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: old_subnet_prefix = int(str(network['cidr']).split('/')[-1]) new_cidr = list(old_cidr.subnet(old_subnet_prefix + 1))[0]

Problem has been fixed by OpenStack Infra team.

commit_message:
Remove check for config files to verify MountFlags

Check MountFlags option with systemd rather than with
configuration files which can be overriden with
different ones.

Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <jeffrey.zhang@99cloud.net>
Change-Id: Ifa4ce62372af3fe75a66b45c8e7cf9ac9f9c2415
Closes-Bug: #1571281
(cherry picked from commit 47894bb05f8446d8db645dcd6dc580d5d4ae64d2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/92/306792/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Checking if 'MountFlags' for docker service is set to 'shared' command: systemctl show docker | grep MountFlags failed_when: result.stdout.find('MountFlags=1048576') == -1
deleted_lines: - name: Checking if 'MountFlags' in /lib/systemd/system/docker.service is set to 'shared' command: cat /lib/systemd/system/docker.service failed_when: result.stdout.find('MountFlags=shared') == -1

commit_message:
Change node group id in test

as "0" will not pass JSON schema validation and error message will be
different (when JSON schema validation for NetworkGroup will be merged
into Nailgun).

Change-Id: I44be6ea10359cd6047f447860967882aea050867
Related-Bug: 1477648

deleted_lines: err_msg = "(Node group with ID 0 does not exist)\n" ("network-group --create --name test --node-group 0 "

commit_message:
Fixed legacy conditions transformations

The multi field conditions do not transform properly
because the regexp uses greedy algorithm

Change-Id: Iad1d839e640942d3a447b226387273b89c040fcd
Closes-Bug: 1569420
(cherry picked from commit 100bb1d4f8e05058313925124b6577c2e0b8c1b1)

commit_message:
Remove *_id arg from create_record/recordset in the storage layer

We do we this for consistency across all the methods, instead requiring the
domain_id/recordset_id to be supplied as part of the Object. Additionally,
we remove a few un-necessary database round trips.

Change-Id: Ie74f3f7b6d2046ea9614a31318624492a008c4a3

commit_message:
WIP: Add Healthcheck middleware

Add Healthcheck middleware to be used as a test endpoint for frontend
load balancers and monitoring.

Will fail requirements gate ultil o.middleware 0.4.0 is allowed.

commit_message:
Replace logging._lock

Currently the 'logging' module is initialised before eventlet is
monkeypatched. As part of this it creates a 'threading.RLock' to
serialise reconfiguration. 'threading' locks are unsafe for use in an
eventlet environment.

Before fileConfig is called the first time, replace logging._lock with
a green lock.

bp mutable-logging

Change-Id: Iabc9c70ab12fabea9fc187545169215f01eaf723
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log refs/changes/27/295927/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOCK = None try: import eventlet LOCK = eventlet.green.threading.RLock() except ImportError: pass global LOCK if LOCK: LOCK.acquire() logging._lock = LOCK LOCK = None logging._lock.release()

commit_message:
Add api for getting pool manager statuses

There is now a new endpoint for admin related apis.
These apis are not supported across versions. By default
these are disabled. enable_api_admin under service:api
needs to be set to True to enable these apis.
Added an api (/admin/status/pools) for retrieving pool
manager statuses.
No changes can be done through the API. Only get
and list operations are permitted. Filtering on server_id,
zone_id (or domain_id), action and status can be done.
Note that these apis call into pool manger rather than
go through central. One disadvantage of this could be
specifying additional firewall rules.

Change-Id: Id19d6b84808b1b2ef0b1fcefdf85ffa0ccce191b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/48/139748/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 Rackspace Hosting # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import pecan from designate.openstack.common import log as logging from designate import exceptions from designate import schema from designate import utils from designate.api.v2.controllers import rest from designate.api.v2.views \ import pool_manager_status as pool_manager_status_view LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class PoolManagerStatusController(rest.RestController): _view = pool_manager_status_view.PoolManagerStatusView() _resource_schema = schema.Schema('v2', 'pool_manager_status') _collection_schema = schema.Schema('v2', 'pool_manager_statuses') SORT_KEYS = ['created_at', 'id', 'updated_at', 'server_id', 'domain_id'] @staticmethod def get_path(): return '.status' @pecan.expose(template='json:', content_type='application/json') @utils.validate_uuid('status_id') def get_one(self, status_id): """Get a particular Pool Manager status""" request = pecan.request context = request.environ['context'] pool_manager_status = self.central_api.get_pool_manager_status( context, status_id) return self._view.show(context, request, pool_manager_status) @pecan.expose(template='json:', content_type='application/json') def get_all(self, **params): """List Pool Manager Statuses""" request = pecan.request context = request.environ['context'] # Extract the pagination params marker, limit, sort_key, sort_dir = self._get_paging_params(params) # validate server_id and domain_id for k in ('server_id', 'zone_id', 'domain_id'): if k in params: if not utils.is_uuid_like(params[k]): msg = 'Invalid UUID %s: %s' % (k, params[k]) raise exceptions.InvalidUUID(msg) if 'zone_id' in params: params['domain_id'] = params['zone_id'] # Extract any filter params. accepted_filters = ('server_id', 'domain_id', 'action', 'status') criterion = dict((k, params[k]) for k in accepted_filters if k in params) # Retrieve pool manager statuses pool_manager_statuses = self.central_api.find_pool_manager_statuses( context, criterion, marker, limit, sort_key, sort_dir) return self._view.list(context, request, pool_manager_statuses)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/92/308992/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: `Home <index.html>`_ OpenStack-Ansible Installation Guide Configuring the ironic service (optional) ----------------------------------------- .. note:: This feature is experimental at this time and it has not been fully production tested yet. This implementation instructions assume that Ironic is being deployed as the sole hypervisor for the region. .. toctree:: configure-ironic-deployment.rst configure-ironic-neutron.rst configure-ironic-images.rst configure-ironic-flavor.rst configure-ironic-nodes.rst configure-ironic-baremetal-node.rst Ironic is an OpenStack project which provisions bare metal (as opposed to virtual) machines by leveraging common technologies such as PXE boot and IPMI to cover a wide range of hardware, while supporting pluggable drivers to allow vendor-specific functionality to be added. OpenStacks Ironic project makes physical servers as easy to provision as virtual machines in a cloud, which in turn will open up new avenues for enterprises and service providers.

commit_message:
Add a per tenant options endpoint

This allows for options to be stored on a per tenant basis.

This can be used by sink handlers / plugins to allow users to
customise their usage

Change-Id: Ia8f0ab48417236c8a3ad30cd587c1dc243f85c1d

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Rackspace # # Author: Betsy Luzader <betsy.luzader@rackspace.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from designate.api.v2.views import base as base_view from designate.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class OptionsView(base_view.BaseView): """ Model a Blacklist API response as a python dictionary """ _resource_name = 'option' _collection_name = 'options' def show_basic(self, context, request, option): """ Detailed view of an option """ return { "id": option['id'], "key": option['key'], "value": option['value'], "created_at": option['created_at'], "updated_at": option['updated_at'], "links": self._get_resource_links(request, option) } def load(self, context, request, body): """ Extract a "central" compatible dict from an API call """ valid_keys = ('key', 'value') return self._load(context, request, body, valid_keys)

commit_message:
Remove downloading debian-installer components

In Fuel 7.0 we dropped classic provisioning mode,
fully switching to IBP. Remove pre-provision task
of downloading of debian-installer parts and related
script.

Related-Bug: #1549346
Depends-On: I36ff56c1e4a0437b33fc8e31da3df6f311607307
Change-Id: I1001225edd737a29edc263fee48715ba52f53af7

added_lines: class TestEnvironmentStackShow(TestStack): SAMPLE_ENV = { 'parameters': {'p1': 'v1'}, 'resource_registry': {'r1': 't1'} } def setUp(self): super(TestEnvironmentStackShow, self).setUp() self.cmd = stack.EnvironmentShowStack(self.app, None) def test_stack_environment_show(self): # Setup self.stack_client.environment = mock.MagicMock( return_value=self.SAMPLE_ENV ) # Test parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, ['test-stack'], []) columns, outputs = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) # Verify self.assertEqual(['parameters', 'resource_registry'], columns) self.assertEqual({'p1': 'v1'}, outputs[0]) def test_stack_environment_show_no_parameters(self): # Setup sample_env = copy.deepcopy(self.SAMPLE_ENV) sample_env.pop('parameters') self.stack_client.environment = mock.MagicMock( return_value=sample_env ) # Test parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, ['test-stack'], []) columns, outputs = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) # Verify self.assertEqual(['resource_registry'], columns) self.assertEqual({'r1': 't1'}, outputs[0]) def test_stack_environment_show_no_registry(self): # Setup sample_env = copy.deepcopy(self.SAMPLE_ENV) sample_env.pop('resource_registry') self.stack_client.environment = mock.MagicMock( return_value=sample_env ) # Test parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, ['test-stack'], []) columns, outputs = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) # Verify self.assertEqual(['parameters'], columns) self.assertEqual({'p1': 'v1'}, outputs[0])

commit_message:
Fix an error in senlin api reference

This patch fix an error in senlin api reference: response of
cluster/node create API actually don't include action field.

Change-Id: I17e4907ee6db8247fc0d83cfea5f04284ae92c18

subject: Fix getter behaviour on py3 if obj_load_attr fails
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-21 11:28:27.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/base.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects/commit/3817bb53e1d9e23a38a7414828b3b99395864c03', 'message': 'Fix getter behaviour on py3 if obj_load_attr fails

With py3 hasattr now expects a specific AttributeError [1] to be thrown if
an attribute is not found when calling getter. Previously with py2 any
exception thrown by getter was caught by hasattr and taken to mean that
the attribute was not present [2].

obj_load_attr should in turn avoid throwing NotImplementedError as this
breaks hasattr in py3.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#hasattr
[2] https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html#hasattr

Change-Id: I8d112dae60868e93a099027a1b51a631ee7c35fe
'}]
commit_message:
Fix getter behaviour on py3 if obj_load_attr fails

With py3 hasattr now expects a specific AttributeError [1] to be thrown if
an attribute is not found when calling getter. Previously with py2 any
exception thrown by getter was caught by hasattr and taken to mean that
the attribute was not present [2].

obj_load_attr should in turn avoid throwing NotImplementedError as this
breaks hasattr in py3.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#hasattr
[2] https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html#hasattr

Change-Id: I8d112dae60868e93a099027a1b51a631ee7c35fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/32/308932/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Avoid using cgroups with no settings

Check parsed cgroups settings (which exclude
service "metadata" key) instead of raw ones.

Change-Id: I4ffec8c692e6ffbfc3fba8f04c7870ada531b47a
Closes-Bug: #1571681
(cherry picked from commit 9ba20fd0a3f67e1a558fb152b1a752fad0bb3211)

commit_message:
Use NUMATopologyFilter for HugePages deployment

Nova scheduler has an ability to detect compute nodes with appropriate huge
pages sizes and schedule instances on them without host aggregates

Change-Id: If093b5a704b745feb9a2164bfc988d1172b8f1c5
Closes-bug: #1569775
(cherry picked from commit dd9378a7ee0234f6079d3e3b60beb275e00b6521)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/12/308812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $huge_pages_filters = $use_huge_pages ? { true => [ 'NUMATopologyFilter' ], default => []}

Change-Id: I173a4db6d14e22cbe11fc790e537b8f226db65f3

commit_message:
Honor upper-constraints

Since we don't have many special requirements anymore, we can honor
upper-constraints and avoid some gate breakages.

Cap on pytest is dropped because latest version works just fine on 2.7
and we don't support 2.6 anymore (in master). It gets overwritten by
upper-constraints anyhow.

Change-Id: I173a4db6d14e22cbe11fc790e537b8f226db65f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/45/308945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt} -U {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Add ServerGet task to nodepool graphs

We also perform a direct ServerGet in some cases - specifically once for
each server create.

Change-Id: I58fd87a8efbf66be785ecec9d3db1abaec5a4816

commit_message:
Add new virtualbmc project under ironic's umbrella

VirtualBMC is a utility that allows virtual/fake BMCs to be created
handling the IPMI commands and converting it to calls to the
python-libvirt library. The project was created to allow drivers using
the IPMI protocol to be tested in the Ironic gate.

Related-Bug: #1570301
Needed-By: I24349ce1b5c0332157f1bf8bd0613338a15495e4
Change-Id: Idf02cb28316be1846bb5fa1988c3d47ce6f9c54c

commit_message:
ceph configuration for nova glance and cinder

configuration examples for nova glance and cinder to use ceph

Change-Id: Id0655f2ac14e6f375e88c31067ca6fb6a18f2e12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/22/301922/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _OpenStack Ansible and Ceph Working Example: https://www.openstackfaq.com/openstack-ansible-ceph/ Configuring Ceph storage servers is outside the scope of this documentation. Ceph configuration. The following example configuration sets nova and glance to use ceph pools: ephemeral-vms and glance-images respectively. It assumes cephx authentication, and two accounts created, glance for glance-images and cinder for ephemeral-vms. glance_default_store: rbd glance_notification_driver: noop glance_ceph_client: glance glance_rbd_store_pool: glance-images glance_rbd_store_chunk_size: 8 nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool: ephemeral-vms cinder_ceph_client: cinder cephx: true ceph_mons: - 172.29.244.20 - 172.29.244.21 - 172.29.244.22
deleted_lines: Configuring Ceph storage servers is outside the scope of this documentation.Ceph configuration: ceph_conf_file: | [global] fsid = 4037aa5f-abde-4378-9470-f73dbd6ceaba mon_initial_members = mon1.example.local,mon2.example.local,mon3.example.local mon_host = 10.16.5.40,10.16.5.41,10.16.5.42 auth_cluster_required = cephx auth_service_required = cephx auth_client_required = cephx ceph_mons: ['192.168.1.10', '192.168.1.11', '192.168.1.12']

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/86/305586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: `Home <index.html>`_ OpenStack-Ansible Installation Guide Configuring the Ironic service (optional) ----------------------------------------- .. toctree:: configure-ironic-deployment.rst configure-ironic-neutron.rst configure-ironic-images.rst configure-ironic-flavor.rst configure-ironic-nodes.rst configure-ironic-baremetal-nodes.rst configure-ironic-verification.rst Ironic is an OpenStack project which provisions bare metal (as opposed to virtual) machines by leveraging common technologies such as PXE boot and IPMI to cover a wide range of hardware, while supporting pluggable drivers to allow vendor-specific functionality to be added. OpenStacks Ironic project makes physical servers as easy to provision as virtual machines in cloud, which in turn will open up new avenues for enterprises and service providers.

commit_message:
Add TTL for distributed lock

The problem is that after a neutron server instance acquires the
distributed lock for a given object, it crashes before the lock
is released. As a result, the lock state will never be changed.

This patch adds a ttl for each lock. If it is timeout, the lock
state will be reset.

Change-Id: I3862a7154ef8371ff855a937a9cb8fa736e832e4
Closes-Bug: #1571565
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/94/307494/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.IntOpt('distributed_lock_ttl', default=120, help=_('The TTL of the distributed lock. The lock will be ' 'reset if it is timeout.')),

commit_message:
Change keystone admin/internal insecure flags

Make `keystone_service_internaluri_insecure` and
`keystone_service_adminuri_insecure` flag default values
derived from facts like protocol each endpoint is using and
kind of certificates being used to reach that endpoint
(user-provided or self-signed).

Change-Id: I921031c676776884cb121a7914fcd9c505345e67
Closes-Bug: 1566629
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/12/307512/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: keystone_service_adminuri_insecure: "{{ keystone_service_internaluri_insecure }}"

commit_message:
Remove debian-installer placeholders

In Fuel 7.0 we dropped classical provisioning mode,
fully switching to IBP. Since then, placeholders
created for Ubuntu cobbler profile, are no longer
needed. Also, remove 'fuel' package dependency for
the 'fuel-provisioning-scripts' which contains
debian-installer download script.

Related-Bug: #1549346
Change-Id: I36ff56c1e4a0437b33fc8e31da3df6f311607307
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/87/294087/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

So, we # just touch these files to work around cobbler's limitation. mkdir -p ${wwwdir}/${OPENSTACK_VERSION}/ubuntu/x86_64/images/ touch ${wwwdir}/${OPENSTACK_VERSION}/ubuntu/x86_64/images/linux touch ${wwwdir}/${OPENSTACK_VERSION}/ubuntu/x86_64/images/initrd.gz

commit_message:
Dynamically determine whether Neutron Agents should be enabled

Both the Nuage and PLUMgrid configuration guides advocate overwriting
the entire neutron_services dict in order to disable the DHCP,
Metadata and LinuxBridge Agents. This method is prone to error and
should ideally be more dynamic.

This patch implements a more dynamic approach based on the
neutron_plugin_type and the neutron_ml2_mechanism_drivers that are
set.

This will hopefully simplify the configuration of these and other
ML2 mechanisms (eg: openvswitch) when they're implemented.

Backport for: I38e1fad4dfae24b32f4370b3da16561c42cd670d

Change-Id: Ic9a0078503eb196ca4a9fe09f7264042712eb1a8
Signed-off-by: Javeria Khan <javeriak@plumgrid.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/17/308517/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: service_en: "{{ neutron_dhcp | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_linuxbridge | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_metadata | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_metering | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_l3 | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_lbaas | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_lbaasv2 | bool }}"## Neutron DHCP Agent neutron_dhcp: "{% if neutron_plugin_type == 'ml2' %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}" ## Neutron Metadata Agent neutron_metadata: "{% if neutron_plugin_type == 'ml2' %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}" ## Neutron LinuxBridge Agent neutron_linuxbridge: "{% if neutron_plugin_type == 'ml2' and 'linuxbridge' in neutron_ml2_mechanism_drivers %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}"
deleted_lines: service_en: True service_en: True service_en: True service_en: "{{ neutron_metering }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_l3 }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_lbaas }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_lbaasv2 }}"

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 11:16:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/99a8a94a7669515e9fcf96877957197c499abf43', 'message': 'Net topology: Show console link only when useful

commit_message:
Net topology: Show console link only when useful

Right now we are showing the "open console" link on the
network topology screen for instances on each instance,
even if they are on a status that we know its not
going to allow the console to connect.

This patch makes it so the "open console" link will
only appear if the instance object has console data.

It also changes the order of getting the instance
data in the django part as to make less calls if we
dont need the console link.

Provides a list with known statuses that wont connect
to the console used to get the console data or not.

Change-Id: I536fee5186ac933b92a7dc01a2a5b82a6db0ae4c
Closes-Bug: #1543316
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/11/278311/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% comment %}The console link will only appear if the console item is defined on the javascript side while rendering the template.{% endcomment %} [[#console]] [[/console]]
deleted_lines: {% comment %}The Console link is available if settings.CONSOLE_TYPE is not set at all, or if it's set to any value other than None or False.{% endcomment %} {% if console_type %} [[#console_id]] [[/console_id]] {% endif %}

commit_message:
Use six.moves.urllib.parse urlencode

Rather than having to do try/except for imports,
just use six.moves for loading this module.

Change-Id: If750253d7e02608fd183675bd97e3956fbfb0853

commit_message:
Handle async Tooz calls appropriately

he CoordinationMixin treats some async calls as synchronous, in
environments with high latency etc, this can result in out of
order operations causing failures.

Change-Id: Ic8ce8f08910681260ccb77f423ac1a8fa19d8bd1
Closes-Bug: 1566285

commit_message:
use path as resource id when missing RESELLER prefix

we don't have an id if RESELLER prefix is not in path. this causes
an id to be autogenerated making each request a completely different
resource id.

this patch changes it so we just default to path as our id if one
cannot be computed.

Change-Id: I5775406a84b5f2ad0f95f366b7deca210d2f8e87
Closes-Bug: #1566940
(cherry picked from commit 0789e5e30ca71b05d893b050a724f3c48421d183)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometermiddleware refs/changes/34/307834/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_incomplete_reseller_prefix(self): def test_invalid_reseller_prefix(self): app = swift.Swift( FakeApp(), {'reseller_prefix': 'AUTH_'}) req = FakeRequest('/1.0/admin/bucket', environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'GET'}) with mock.patch('oslo_messaging.Notifier.info') as notify: list(app(req.environ, self.start_response)) self.assertEqual(1, len(notify.call_args_list)) data = notify.call_args_list[0][0] self.assertEqual("1.0/admin/bucket", data[2]['target']['id'])

commit_message:
Config options: Centralize network options

This change moves the config options in network/__init__.py
to a central location "nova/conf/network.py".

Change-Id: Iaa6a009e007093fbf4268aadf1b59a7e641725d6

commit_message:
Remove unused rotation param from _do_snapshot_instance

The parameter isn't used, it must have been left out
as a result of refactoring some of this code, so just
remove it.

Change-Id: I1b99c6ed61eab71382e6ee25333b23e6fd0070af

deleted_lines: def _do_snapshot_instance(self, context, image_id, instance, rotation): self._do_snapshot_instance(context, image_id, instance, rotation)

commit_message:
virt: use more realistic fake network / VIF data

The get_test_network_info() method used by several virt driver
tests returns a VIF model with alot of bogus data

 - a MAC address of 'fake' which is not valid (should be 6 pairs
   of colon separated hex digits)
 - a unrealistic bridge name 'fake' (using br0 is a more obvious
   bridge name)
 - a UUID for the VIF which is not a valid (should be 32 hex
   characters)
 - a id for the Network which is None
 - IPv6 addresses that are in fact IPv4 addresses
 - IPv4/6 cidr fields which lack the network prefix

Change-Id: Ieb5e8b6f36022f5da3bf048e2bfb1f6c945038ff
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Initial use of microversion_parse

microversion_parse is a new simple library that does one job: it
extracts microversions from headers. By default it will look for
the new style 'OpenStack-API-Version: compute 2.15' but can be
called to look in a variety of old style headers.

In this change 'X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version: 2.15' continues to
work and no further changes are done. Followup patches will add
tests for the new style header and versioning of the microversion
(if required).

Depends-On: Iea8bf5cc70ad24bb352347ef347be71817db3dc5
Change-Id: I9098ab8f0800fb0550887f5eff219b18addde709

commit_message:
Replace Mox with Mock

According to [1] "New test cases should be implemented using Mock.
It is part of the Python standard library in Python 3 and as such
is the preferred method for OpenStack." So let's kill Mox in favor
of Mock.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#peer-review

Change-Id: I0db1cf3969a8d5ae90e1a13330799e69c7751207

commit_message:
Add rebuild action descriptions in support-matrix

Currently the rebuild action is supported in API and CLI of nova
though only ironic driver has its own implementation, we can still
list it into the support matix to provide more info to user.

Change-Id: I391b54a383501d3cdd2ac799d0ce4ccf66243f5a

Currently except ironic driver all the other Though this is not considered to be a mandatory operation to support. Currently except ironic driver all the other virt driver use the default compute layer implementation. cli=nova rebuild <server> <image>; driver-impl-xenserver=unknown driver-impl-libvirt-kvm-x86=complete driver-impl-libvirt-kvm-ppc64=complete driver-impl-libvirt-kvm-s390x=complete driver-impl-libvirt-qemu-x86=complete driver-impl-libvirt-lxc=complete driver-impl-libvirt-xen=complete driver-impl-vmware=complete driver-impl-hyperv=complete driver-impl-ironic=complete driver-impl-libvirt-vz-vm=complete driver-impl-libvirt-vz-ct=complete

commit_message:
Add functional test for v2.7

microversion v2.7 was added without a functional test,
even though we can cover most cases in unit test
for negative case, it would be better to
have a functional test for a specific microversion API change.

Change-Id: I4d5576cc4ebcdeaa4e4f067fe9c6207280ad7eda

commit_message:
Ensure libvirt-services running on Ubuntu

On Ubuntu services don't autostart when
"nova-compute" package being installed (due to
"tweaks::ubuntu_service_override").
This behaviour affects services from auto-
installed packages (dependencies for "nova-
compute").
These services are provided by puppet-nova,
so they should be ensured by Puppet.

Closes-bug: #1569378

Change-Id: I0b1658d8d19dcb1b1115712d5e9314d3b45bc6ba

commit_message:
Revert "Cluster capacity calculation fix"

Cluster capacity calculation take into account hardware parameters
of all the cluster nodes despite on their roles.

This reverts commit I0a44cbfa60625ad06c879cf1aac01317b073b802

Related-Bug: #1556909

Change-Id: I183c15cb22e6ccbfa7209053c64ae72db7b1a160

added_lines: RESOURCE_DEFAULT_PAGINATION = ['revision_start:asc', 'started_at:asc'] def get_pagination_options(params, default): max_limit = pecan.request.conf.api.max_limit limit = params.get('limit', max_limit) marker = params.get('marker') sorts = params.get('sort', default) if not isinstance(sorts, list): sorts = [sorts] try: limit = PositiveNotNullInt(limit) except ValueError: abort(400, "Invalid 'limit' value: %s" % params.get('limit')) limit = min(limit, max_limit) return {'limit': limit, 'marker': marker, 'sorts': sorts}

subject: Enable all ES6 features for the whole project
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-20 16:47:34.000000000', 'files': ['static/.eslintrc', '.eslintrc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui/commit/f3623898637bc896cdfc773f7ff0265791c64599', 'message': "Enable all ES6 features for the whole project

Some of ES6 features (like template strings, let, const, etc)
were disabled as we couldn't enable them in our functional
tests, so we would end up with 2 code styles. Since the tests
are also transpiled, we can enable all the features.

no-use-before-define was disabled as it started to cause errors
on the networks tab on the code which looked totally fine, and
fixing them would cause the code look worse.

Change-Id: I5e20b1f7ebb6c18e31faa19271b73f53b5aea878
"}]
commit_message:
Enable all ES6 features for the whole project

Some of ES6 features (like template strings, let, const, etc)
were disabled as we couldn't enable them in our functional
tests, so we would end up with 2 code styles. Since the tests
are also transpiled, we can enable all the features.

no-use-before-define was disabled as it started to cause errors
on the networks tab on the code which looked totally fine, and
fixing them would cause the code look worse.

Change-Id: I5e20b1f7ebb6c18e31faa19271b73f53b5aea878

commit_message:
Update 'os-hypervisors.inc' in api-ref

some changes including:
1) update the wrong reference link to json file
2) Add /v2.1/{tenant_id}/os-hypervisors/detail
3) Add /v2.1/{tenant_id}/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}/search
4) Add /v2.1/{tenant_id}/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}/servers

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: I73fbf4583cd75afb2f60c57acd1bdb179f86a9e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/37/307137/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: List Hypervisors Details ======================== .. rest_method:: GET /v2.1/{tenant_id}/os-hypervisors/detail Lists hypervisors details. Normal response codes: 200 Error response codes: computeFault(400, 500), serviceUnavailable(503), badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), badMethod(405), itemNotFound(404) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - tenant_id: tenant_id Response -------- **Example List Hypervisors Details: JSON request** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-hypervisors/hypervisors-detail-resp.json :language: javascript .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-hypervisors/hypervisor-statistics-resp.json.. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-hypervisors/hypervisor-uptime-resp.jsonSearch Hypervisor ================= .. rest_method:: GET /v2.1/{tenant_id}/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}/search Search hypervisor by given hypervisor id. Normal response code: 200 Error response codes: computeFault(400, 500), serviceUnavailable(503), badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), badMethod(405), itemNotFound(404) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - tenant_id: tenant_id - hypervisor_id: hypervisor_id Response -------- **Example Search Hypervisor: JSON request** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-hypervisors/hypervisors-search-resp.json :language: javascript List Hypervisor Servers ======================= .. rest_method:: GET /v2.1/{tenant_id}/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}/servers List all servers belong to given hypervisor. Normal response code: 200 Error response codes: computeFault(400, 500), serviceUnavailable(503), badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), badMethod(405), itemNotFound(404) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - tenant_id: tenant_id - hypervisor_id: hypervisor_id Response -------- **Example List Hypervisor Servers: JSON request** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-hypervisors/hypervisors-with-servers-resp.json :language: javascript

command, it also do not offer an interface to do it, so I'm calling

commit_message:
Fix stable/liberty gate

**This patch is a merge of 2 patches that needed to be backported**

unwedge the gate

devstack defaults to v3 and makes some janky assumptions in
the generated rc files
(cherry picked from commit bd14d078098eb2055c0dae784de892b0b1346ed5)

Add all regions to cloud configuration

OCC now requires all regions to be listed in the cloud
configuration. Update the shell unit tests to list all
of the regions being tested.

Change-Id: Ic7300d1f708339701b5daadbf2c4769b239a2adb
(cherry picked from commit d1311f9742ad93198b9ca72f47d51710e17ced38)

commit_message:
comapre dict instead of json.dumps string

json.dumps result is unpredictable, which causes unit test fail
randomly, let's use json.loads then compare the dict.

Change-Id: I885e4381cffd7530d414b4d62cb4479c5204ec8c
ref: http://logs.openstack.org/68/308568/1/check/gate-python-heatclient-python34/8ba0f65/console.html#_2016-04-20_21_41_59_779

Totally drop Qpid support

Qpid was removed in Mitaka from Oslo Messaging, so now we can
drop it in manifests.

commit_message:
Enforce limit for metric-list when dimensions are not specified

Over some query optimization refactoring, we've lost the enforcement
of the max row limit for metric-list (unless dimensions are specified).
The metric-list for our infrastructure project now returns 7M rows,
far exceeding the limit in our config file.

Change-Id: Ibce396db0f7cd6a10fccfa683debf4ecb52d1e7e

commit_message:
Cast region key's value as an integer

This correctly casts the region number from the Swift contents file as
an integer which is expected by the string formatter.

Change-Id: Ic0b28eb73f794d20cea3fbccba281c3081fd93e5
Closes-Bug: #1567666

commit_message:
Update deprecated commands in tripleo.sh (Old heat * calls)

Update the references of 'heat *' calls.

In this patch, calls to 'heat *' are replaced using the OpenStack CLI.
This change was applied to:
    --overcloud-delete option
    cleanup_pingtest method

To support backwards compatibility with Liberty a bash snippet was
used to redefine the openstack command, and call the previous 'heat *'
interface when apply.

Change-Id: Ie062f55e29a1b0cdaf6249dbb08815c31642b60c

added_lines: if openstack stack show "$OVERCLOUD_NAME" | grep "stack_status " | egrep "(CREATE|UPDATE)_COMPLETE"; then OVERCLOUD_ID=$(openstack stack list | grep "$OVERCLOUD_NAME" | awk '{print $2}') if $(tripleo wait_for -w $OVERCLOUD_DELETE_TIMEOUT -d 10 -s "DELETE_COMPLETE" -- "openstack stack show $OVERCLOUD_ID"); then openstack stack show $OVERCLOUD_ID if tripleo wait_for -w 300 -d 10 -s "Stack not found" -- "openstack stack show tenant-stack"; then if tripleo wait_for -w 360 -d 10 -s "CREATE_COMPLETE" -- "openstack stack list | grep tenant-stack"; then openstack stack show tenant-stack || :

commit_message:
New project devstack-plugin-tar-installer

The main reason to create this new project is a request from the
community in the context of this devstack patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/108714/

The objective is to enable devstack to install software
(QEMU and libvirt for the time being) from tar releases. The
project devstack-plugin-tar-installer will host the devstack plugin
which implements this feature.

Change-Id: Iddaf12ba79aa70b6045826568319a163e75347b6
Signed-off-by: Michele Paolino <m.paolino@virtualopensystems.com>

commit_message:
Correct format of patch paths

Without b/ prefix to the path, the patching function apply_patches
from util/docker.py cannot find the file to copy to temp patching
dir from the container.

Change-Id: I05d1c5cc28d15d7d1a759e3fb196dc16fdc7d7d9
Closes-bug: 1570426

commit_message:
fix release notes build

Add the missing file to show changes from the "current" branch, allowing
reviewers to see how release notes file render before approving the
patches.

Remove the stray reference to README.rst in the toctree, since there is
no such file.

Add the -W option to the build so that bad notes that break sphinx fail
the release notes job.

Change-Id: I756ec20f85b7ba9f1e5cf713f480611bf8c94bc1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/50/308450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = sphinx-build -W -a -E -d releasenotes/build/doctrees -b html releasenotes/source releasenotes/build/html
deleted_lines: commands = sphinx-build -a -E -d releasenotes/build/doctrees -b html releasenotes/source releasenotes/build/html

commit_message:
Ensure that tasks fail early if there is no ssh public key configured

One of the most common causes of failure in an initial deployment is
that the LXC hosts aren't configured with a ssh public key to
implement into the container caches.

This patch ensures that the play will fatally stop if this
configuration has not been implemented.

Change-Id: I167446eee35e40cde645873fbab7491f840dcd15
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/32/307732/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check for the presence of a public key file on the host stat: path: /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub register: _ssh_key when: lxc_container_ssh_key is undefined tags: - always - name: Fail if a ssh public key is not set in a var and not present on the host fail: msg: "Please set the lxc_container_ssh_key variable or ensure that the host has the file /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub present." when: - lxc_container_ssh_key is undefined - not _ssh_key.stat.exists tags: - always

commit_message:
make compare_tarball_diff.sh quieter

Silence some of the output so the total length of the output log is
short enough to fit in a pastebin.

commit_message:
Publish test_reports dir

It's a good idea to publish test_reports dir with tree structure.
It will help us to make very flexible test reports without changing
job configuration.
For ex. right now I implemented a patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/307880/,
that creates separated logs for each fallen test as test folder with browser log,
test log, browser screenshot, and page source. But due to current restrictions
itn's possible to map my reports to jenkins report.
That's why we need this patch.

Change-Id: I124973d9adbaaacf5d3429e6f6684f15de27dc7f
Needed-By: Ie5d972d2a560d4f59666c49dc3bf22fdb48071e8

commit_message:
Skip networking-nec python34 job for liberty and kilo

networking-nec liberty and older does not support python34.
When python34 job was added, I forgot to add branch condition.

Change-Id: Id0ef0ff2c8f4f423babc870421ce9e118745b46a

commit_message:
Remove check for config files to verify MountFlags

Check MountFlags option with systemd rather than with
configuration files which can be overriden with
different ones.

Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <jeffrey.zhang@99cloud.net>
Change-Id: Ifa4ce62372af3fe75a66b45c8e7cf9ac9f9c2415
Closes-Bug: #1571281
(cherry picked from commit 47894bb05f8446d8db645dcd6dc580d5d4ae64d2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/59/308759/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # When MountFlags is set to shared, a signal bit configured on 20th bit of a number # We need to check the 20th bit. 2^20 = 1048576. So we are validating against it. - name: Checking if 'MountFlags' for docker service is set to 'shared' command: systemctl show docker failed_when: result.stdout.find('MountFlags=1048576') == -1
deleted_lines: - name: Checking if 'MountFlags' in /lib/systemd/system/docker.service is set to 'shared' command: cat /lib/systemd/system/docker.service failed_when: result.stdout.find('MountFlags=shared') == -1

commit_message:
Safe oslo releases for the week of april 18th, 2016

Release a bunch of libraries for this week, none of these
libraries currently should cause any issues (which I for
one would rather not have during this soon to be summit
week).

Change-Id: Ib25b42170a2cb526f3b09d807c1f6a69fbee3dc9

commit_message:
Allow network modifications if cluster is not locked

Removed separate logic to check that network modifications
are allowed, start to using the property cluster.is_locked

Change-Id: If23037731b6764c7e8c5c1243eeda7b8e6ee9c3e
Closes-Bug: 1568780
(cherry picked from commit e3072530eb7075d127280bce360c89b6cce82929)

commit_message:
Revert "Cluster capacity calculation fix"

Cluster capacity calculation take into account hardware parameters
of all the cluster nodes despite on their roles.

This reverts commit I0a44cbfa60625ad06c879cf1aac01317b073b802

Related-Bug: #1556909

Change-Id: I183c15cb22e6ccbfa7209053c64ae72db7b1a160

commit_message:
Disable Murano tests

Disable Murano test according to Murano servise is not available out of box.
Also delete murano option from test deploy_multiple_services_local_mirror,
because we can not disable our single scenarion for check mirros

Change-Id: I9e6b8699c890a10fe6ea1e5267161a5c69125843
Related-Bug: #1546080

commit_message:
Update reference list for Neutron projects

Commit 846a52873 introduced a selection criterion for Neutron projects
whereby no interface to proprietary system is vouched for by the Neutron
core team. These initiatives come in the form of ML2 mechanism drivers,
or service plugins, and can bring extensions of their own. Now that Mitaka
is behind us, let's reflect this team decision in the governance repo.

Change-Id: Icb3d33af0e32919bb13c52b3662f481c2c99011c
